BBSlider

BBSlider is a slider for multiple ranges. Try to click on the bar above.

Slider has no dependencies and can be used as AMD module, CommonJS, or a standalone <script>.

Usage is simple as this: 

var slider = new BBSlider({
    min: 0,
    max: 100,
    step: 10
});
document.getElementById('el').appendChild(slider.el);

You can download slider via npm 

npm install bbslider

Methods

.val()

slider.val(); // => [[40, 60], [80, 100]]

.rangeValue(rangeId)

returns a value of range specified by rangeId. If range doesn't exists returns false. 

slider.rangeValue(1); // => [40, 60]

.rangeValue(rangeId, value)

sets a value of range specified by rangeId. Returns true if range exists, otherwise false. 

slider.rangeValue(1, [10, 20]);

.data()

returns all data about the slider. 

{
    totalLength: int, // total length of all ranges
    rangeList: [
        {
            id: int // rangeId
            val: Array // range value
        },
        {
            id: int
            val: Array
        }
    ]
}

Options

min, max, step

  • All three options are mandatory.
  • All should be integers.
  • max > min.
  • there should be an integer number of steps between max and min.

allowRemove

If sets to true, ranges can be removed with a UI. After removing, the event range:remove is emited.

To remove a range, just decrease its width to zero by dragging the handlers.

maxRanges

Sets maximum of ranges in the slider.

On the example below maxRanges equals 3.

readOnly

If readonly option is set to true, slider can't be changed with the UI, but can be changed with the api.

rangeLabel

function that transforms range value to text written inside the label.

Events

Any callback function can be subscripted with a .on method and can be unsubscripted with a .off method.

change, changing

//Callback argument
{
    val: Array // slider value
    rangeId: integer // range id that was changed
}
  • Total length while changing: 40.
  • Total length after change: 40. 
function getTotalLength(data) {
    var result = 0;
    for (var i = 0; i < data.val.length; i++) {
        result += (data.val[i][1] - data.val[i][0]);
    }
    return result;
}

var result1 = document.getElementById('result1');
var result2 = document.getElementById('result2');

slider.on('changing', function (data) {
    result1.innerHTML = getTotalLength(data).toString();
});
slider.on('change', function (data) {
    result2.innerHTML = getTotalLength(data).toString();
});

range:change, range:changing

//Callback argument
{
    val: Array // range value
    id: integer // range id
}
  • First range length: 40.
  • First range length: 40.
  • Range id that was changed: . 
slider.on('range:changing', function (data) {
    if (data.id == 1) {
        result1.innerHTML = (data.val[1] - data.val[0]).toString();
    }
});

slider.on('range:change', function (data) {
    if (data.id == 1) {
        result2.innerHTML = (data.val[1] - data.val[0]).toString();
    }
    result3.innerHTML = data.id.toString();
});

range:remove

Emits when the range was removed by UI or by api. 
//Callback argument
{
    id: integer // range id
}

range:click

Emits when the range was clicked. 
//Callback argument
{
    id: integer // range id
}
